reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ended up staying here because another temple I wanted to stay at was booked both nights so we spent one night here and I must say I preferred this one. Younger monks commune here, so you get alot of interaction among them. My husband even played baseball with them in the afternoon. What a great experience. The rooms are modest but clean and bright and our room also had a small patio area that opened to a private pond. The food was great and the location was super convenient and close the cemetery.
reviews.title: Great people! Great Location! Excellent Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this temple was the morning services. There was a morning prayer service that I highly recommend even if you don't understand what is going on. The chanting monks and the whole experience is enthralling and breathtaking. After the service, there is a fire ceremony that is simple amazing. I would stay close to the door or open area though because it got pretty smokey in there.
reviews.title: Great experience in Koyasan

likes.liked: — The experience of staying in the temple

reviews.text: We wanted to experience at stay at a Temple in Koyasan and Ekoin was a lovely experience. Our room was simple and as peaceful as we would have hoped. The food was delicious for dinner and breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice temple

reviews.text: The morning services were also wonderful. I was not sure what to expect and I found myself in thralled.
